paragraphs.text:
%sh
# Please follow below steps copy keytab from remote servers, by changing the ONLY parameters that are specified in step3.

cd /opt/zeppelin/confCMLP
ls -ltr

# STEP 1 - login to your remote server where keytab exists.
# STEP 2 - Gennerate a RSA keypair
# STEP 3 - Put private key under folder /opt/zeppelin/conf/YOUR_PRIVATE_KEY.private
# STEP 4 - copy and paste public key to file /YOUR_HOME_FOLDER/.ssh/authorized_keys on server where keytab exists
# STEP 5 - run below comand by updating parameters:
# YOUR_UID, your user id on remote server
# REMOTE_SERVER, the remote server name where your keytab exists, for example zlp12345.vci.att.com
# YOUR_KEYTAB_FILE_PATH, your keytab file with full path, for example /home/ab1234/ab1234.keytab
# YOUR_KEYTAB_FILE_NAME, your keytab file name wihtout path, for example ab1234.keytab

scp -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -i /opt/zeppelin/conf/YOUR_PRIVATE_KEY.private YOUR_UID@REMOTE_SERVER:YOUR_KEYTAB_FILE_PATH /opt/zeppelin/conf/YOUR_KEYTAB_FILE_NAME
